intro: Comesperma minutum, commonly known as the small-flowered comesperma, is a small shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its native habitat. Comesperma minutum is often found in heathlands and coastal areas, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
